channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.description: Tickets for AIE Miami and AIE Europe are on sale now!

item.title: AISURU/Kimwolf Botnet Launches Record-Setting 31.4 Tbps DDoS Attack
item.description: The distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) botnet known as AISURU/Kimwolf has been attributed to a record-setting attack that peaked at 31.4 Terabits per second (Tbps) and lasted only 35 seconds. Cloudflare, which automatically detected and mitigated the activity, said it's part of a growing number...

item.title: Consolidating systems for AI with iPaaS
item.description: For decades, enterprises reacted to shifting business pressures with stopgap technology solutions. To rein in rising infrastructure costs, they adopted cloud services that could scale on demand. When customers shifted their lives onto smartphones, companies rolled out mobile apps to keep pace. And...

item.title: Substack Discloses Security Incident After Hacker Leaks Data
item.description: The hacker claims to have stolen nearly 700,000 Substack user records, including email addresses and phone numbers. The post Substack Discloses Security Incident After Hacker Leaks Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Researchers Expose Network of 150 Cloned Law Firm Websites in AI-Powered Scam Campaign
item.description: Criminals are using AI to clone professional websites at an industrial scale. A new report shows how one AI-powered network grew to 150+ domains by hiding behind Cloudflare and rotating IP ranges. The post Researchers Expose Network of 150 Cloned Law Firm Websites in AI-Powered Scam Campaign...

item.title: VS Code Configs Expose GitHub Codespaces to Attacks
item.description: VS Code-integrated configuration files are automatically executed in Codespaces when the user opens a repository or pull request. The post VS Code Configs Expose GitHub Codespaces to Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: attempting to track AI, and the next generation of nuclear power

item.title: Nullify Secures $12.5 Million in Seed Funding for Cybersecurity AI Workforce
item.description: This latest infusion, led by SYN Ventures, brings the company’s total funding to $16.9 million. The post Nullify Secures $12.5 Million in Seed Funding for Cybersecurity AI Workforce appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ThreatsDay Bulletin: Codespaces RCE, AsyncRAT C2, BYOVD Abuse, AI Cloud Intrusions & 15+ Stories
item.description: This week didn’t produce one big headline. It produced many small signals — the kind that quietly shape what attacks will look like next. Researchers tracked intrusions that start in ordinary places: developer workflows, remote tools, cloud access, identity paths, and even routine user...

item.title: Italy Averted Russian-Linked Cyberattacks Targeting Winter Olympics Websites, Foreign Minister Says
item.description: Italy has foiled a series of cyberattacks targeting some of its foreign ministry offices, including one in Washington. The post Italy Averted Russian-Linked Cyberattacks Targeting Winter Olympics Websites, Foreign Minister Says appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Buyer’s Guide to AI Usage Control
item.description: Today’s “AI everywhere” reality is woven into everyday workflows across the enterprise, embedded in SaaS platforms, browsers, copilots, extensions, and a rapidly expanding universe of shadow tools that appear faster than security teams can track. Yet most organizations still rely on legacy controls...

item.title: Three questions about next-generation nuclear power, answered
item.description: Nuclear power continues to be one of the hottest topics in energy today, and in our recent online Roundtables discussion about next-generation nuclear power, hyperscale AI data centers, and the grid, we got dozens of great audience questions. These ran the gamut, and while we answered quite a few...

item.title: Infy Hackers Resume Operations with New C2 Servers After Iran Internet Blackout Ends
item.description: The elusive Iranian threat group known as Infy (aka Prince of Persia) has evolved its tactics as part of efforts to hide its tracks, even as it readied new command-and-control (C2) infrastructure coinciding with the end of the widespread internet blackout the regime imposed at the start of the...

Every time OpenAI, Google, or Anthropic drops a new frontier large language model, the AI community holds its breath. It...

item.title: Meituan to Acquire Dingdong for US$717 Million
item.description: Meituan has signed an agreement to acquire Chinese fresh grocery e-commerce platform Dingdong for approximately US$717 million.

item.title: ModelBest Open-Sources Next-Generation Multimodal AI Model MiniCPM-o 4.5
item.description: ModelBest has open-sourced MiniCPM-o 4.5, a full-duplex multimodal AI model designed for real-time interactive dialogue, speech generation, and voice cloning.

item.title: vivo Confirms Vlog Camera Project, Targeting DJI Pocket with 2026 Release
item.description: vivo is developing a Vlog camera set to launch in 2026, aiming to compete with DJI Pocket and expand its imaging ecosystem beyond smartphones.

item.title: INFIFORCE Unveils World’s First “Mind-Native” Bipedal Robot: YUANZI
item.description: INFIFORCE has launched YUANZI, a 95 cm “mind-native” bipedal robot designed to grow and evolve alongside its human users.

item.title: Xiaomi Magnetic Lens Enters Mass Production, May Debut as Early as This Year
item.description: Xiaomi’s magnetic modular lens system is reportedly entering mass production, signaling a potential new approach to smartphone imaging.

item.title: [AINews] ElevenLabs $500m Series D at $11B, Cerebras $1B Series H at $23B, Vibe Coding -> Agentic Engineering
item.description: SOTA Audio models, Fast Chips, and Koding Agents are all you need.

item.title: Critical n8n Flaw CVE-2026-25049 Enables System Command Execution via Malicious Workflows
item.description: A new, critical security vulnerability has been disclosed in the n8n workflow automation platform that, if successfully exploited, could result in the execution of arbitrary system commands. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2026-25049 (CVSS score: 9.4), is the result of inadequate sanitization that...

item.title: Knowledge Model Prompting Increases LLM Performance on Planning Tasks
item.description: arXiv:2602.03900v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLM) can struggle with reasoning ability and planning tasks. item.description: arXiv:2602.03950v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Mathematical problem solving is a fundamental benchmark for assessing the reasoning capabilities of artificial intelligence and a gateway to applications in education, science, and engineering where reliable symbolic reasoning is essential. item.title: AgentArk: Distilling Multi-Agent Intelligence into a Single LLM Agent
item.description: arXiv:2602.03955v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: While large language model (LLM) multi-agent systems achieve superior reasoning performance through iterative debate, practical deployment is limited by their high computational cost and error propagation. item.title: Active Epistemic Control for Query-Efficient Verified Planning
item.description: arXiv:2602.03974v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Planning in interactive environments is challenging under partial observability: task-critical preconditions (e.g., object locations or container states) may be unknown at decision time, yet grounding them through interaction is costly. Learned world...

item.title: Adaptive Test-Time Compute Allocation via Learned Heuristics over Categorical Structure
item.description: arXiv:2602.03975v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Test-time computation has become a primary driver of progress in large language model (LLM) reasoning, but it is increasingly bottlenecked by expensive verification. In many reasoning systems, a large fraction of verifier calls are spent on redundant...

item.title: Understanding the Impact of Differentially Private Training on Memorization of Long-Tailed Data
item.description: arXiv:2602.03872v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent research shows that modern deep learning models achieve high predictive accuracy partly by memorizing individual training samples. Such memorization raises serious privacy concerns, motivating the widespread adoption of differentially private...

item.title: Reversible Deep Learning for 13C NMR in Chemoinformatics: On Structures and Spectra
item.description: arXiv:2602.03875v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce a reversible deep learning model for 13C NMR that uses a single conditional invertible neural network for both directions between molecular structures and spectra. The network is built from i-RevNet style bijective blocks, so the forward...

item.title: GOPO: Policy Optimization using Ranked Rewards

However, while reward models are optimized to capture relative preferences, existing policy...

item.title: NeuroPareto: Calibrated Acquisition for Costly Many-Goal Search in Vast Parameter Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2602.03901v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The pursuit of optimal trade-offs in high-dimensional search spaces under stringent computational constraints poses a fundamental challenge for contemporary multi-objective optimization. item.title: GeoIB: Geometry-Aware Information Bottleneck via Statistical-Manifold Compression
item.description: arXiv:2602.03906v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Information Bottleneck (IB) is widely used, but in deep learning, it is usually implemented through tractable surrogates, such as variational bounds or neural mutual information (MI) estimators, rather than directly controlling the MI I(X;Z) itself....

item.title: Linguistic Blind Spots in Clinical Decision Extraction
item.description: arXiv:2602.03942v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Extracting medical decisions from clinical notes is a key step for clinical decision support and patient-facing care summaries. item.title: Likelihood-Based Reward Designs for General LLM Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2602.03979v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) on reasoning benchmarks via reinforcement learning requires a specific reward function, often binary, for each benchmark. This comes with two potential limitations: the need to design the reward, and the...

item.title: Transformers perform adaptive partial pooling
item.description: arXiv:2602.03980v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Because language is creative, any reasonable language model must generalize, deciding what to say in novel contexts by using information from similar contexts. But what about contexts that are not novel but merely infrequent? In hierarchical...

item.title: On the Credibility of Evaluating LLMs using Survey Questions
item.description: arXiv:2602.04033v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent studies evaluate the value orientation of large language models (LLMs) using adapted social surveys, typically by prompting models with survey questions and comparing their responses to average human responses. item.title: LitS: A novel Neighborhood Descriptor for Point Clouds
item.description: With the advancement of 3D scanning technologies, point clouds have become fundamental for representing 3D spatial data, with applications that span across various scientific and technological fields. item.title: X2HDR: HDR Image Generation in a Perceptually Uniform Space
item.description: High-dynamic-range (HDR) formats and displays are becoming increasingly prevalent, yet state-of-the-art image generators (e.g., Stable Diffusion and FLUX) typically remain limited to low-dynamic-range (LDR) output due to the lack of large-scale HDR training data. In this work, we show that existing...

item.title: VISTA-Bench: Do Vision-Language Models Really Understand Visualized Text as Well as Pure Text?
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have achieved impressive performance in cross-modal understanding across textual and visual inputs, yet existing benchmarks predominantly focus on pure-text queries. In real-world scenarios, language also frequently appears as visualized text embedded in images,...

item.title: Active Asymmetric Multi-Agent Multimodal Learning under Uncertainty
item.description: Multi-agent systems are increasingly equipped with heterogeneous multimodal sensors, enabling richer perception but introducing modality-specific and agent-dependent uncertainty. Existing multi-agent collaboration frameworks typically reason at the agent level, assume homogeneous sensing, and...

item.description: An exponential growth of Machine Learning and its Generative AI applications brings with it significant security challenges, often referred to as Adversarial Machine Learning (AML).
